Stepping into an app store prompts a lot of the same anxious feelings you get when you saunter into warehouse emporiums like Costco. Apps both trusted and extra shifty are stacked to the rafters, aisle after aisle. You went in looking for a simple schedule app, but under the crushing weight of a bazillion unknown options, you folded like a cheap card table.That overload confusion has prompted a boom in curated app subscriptions, featuring bundles of high quality utilities all easily accessible via one elegant portal. The model is working out well for Parallels, whose one-year license to their Toolbox bundle for Mac and Windows is on sale now at half off — just $9.99 — from TNW Deals.It’s called Hard Fork DecentralizedWith the Parallels Toolbox, you get over 30 different productivity tools, all deployed from one simple, intuitive interface. Need to grab, convert or edit video or audio from the web? You’re covered? Want to create a drag-and drop zip folder? The Archive tool stands ready.From a countdown clock to a drive cleaner to a bundle of added system optimization and multimedia functions, Parallels comes loaded with an almost shocking ease of use.No matter whether you’re a Windows user or a Mac guy, this bundle has anticipated your needs and selected special apps to get ‘em done.Many of these apps are priced $10 or more on their own, but with your Parallels Toolbox subscription, the entire bundle is available for this limited time only price of $9.99.
